articles.headline: U.S. Will Track Secret Buyers of Luxury Real Estate
articles.snippet: The initiative will start in Manhattan and Miami-Dade County as part of a broader federal effort to focus on money laundering in real estate.
articles.abstract: The initiative will start in Manhattan and Miami-Dade County as part of a broader federal effort to focus on money laundering in real estate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Concerned about illicit money flowing into luxury real estate, the Treasury Department said Wednesday that it would begin identifying and tracking secret buyers of high-end properties.

articles.headline: G.E. Is Moving Headquarters to Boston and Itself Into the Digital Era
articles.snippet: The move from Connecticut is an effort to tap the high-tech environs, with its cluster of research universities, for knowledge and recruiting.
articles.abstract: The move from Connecticut is an effort to tap the high-tech environs, with its cluster of research universities, for knowledge and recruiting.
articles.lead_paragraph: General Electric, the nation’s largest industrial company, makes products like jet engines, locomotives and gas turbines. Its corporate reputation is tied to producing big, heavy equipment — atoms by the ton, not the ephemeral bits of software.

articles.headline: Hemophilia Patient or Drug Seller? Dual Role Creates Ethical Quandary
articles.snippet: When hemophiliacs make their living by selling lucrative hemophilia drugs, patient advocates say it creates a dangerous conflict of interest.
articles.abstract: When hemophiliacs make their living by selling lucrative hemophilia drugs, patient advocates say it creates a dangerous conflict of interest.
articles.lead_paragraph: LaQuenta Caldwell-Moody considered it improper when a pharmacy sales representative tried to take her teenage son, when he was still a minor, to dinner without her.

articles.headline: Al Jazeera America to Shut Down by April
articles.snippet: The cable news outlet, which began broadcasting in August 2013, said it would expand its digital presence in the United States.
articles.abstract: The cable news outlet, which began broadcasting in August 2013, said it would expand its digital presence in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: The cable news channel Al Jazeera America, which debuted in 2013 to great fanfare when it promised to cover American news soberly and seriously, will be shutting down by the end of April. The move was announced at a companywide meeting on Wednesday.

articles.headline: North Korea Is Newest Frontier for a Daredevil Investor
articles.snippet: James Passin of Firebird Management says he believes the neo-Stalinist country holds extensive oil reserves.
articles.abstract: James Passin of Firebird Management says he believes the neo-Stalinist country holds extensive oil reserves.
articles.lead_paragraph: He searched for oil in the badlands of Somalia and fueled a stock market boom in Mongolia. He sued the world’s smallest republic, far out in the Pacific, for a chunk of what it is worth.

articles.headline: Stocks Slide as Worries Persist Over Global Growth
articles.snippet: Two of Wall Street’s main gauges are down 10 percent from their most recent high, which is called a correction, and the Dow is close.
articles.abstract: Two of Wall Street’s main gauges are down 10 percent from their most recent high, which is called a correction, and the Dow is close.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hopes for a recovery in the United States stock market were dashed on Wednesday as investors’ deepening fears about the strength of the world’s largest economies drove another wave of selling.

articles.headline: Ted Cruz Didn’t Report Goldman Sachs Loan in a Senate Race
articles.snippet: As Mr. Cruz tells it, loyalty and sacrifice helped finance his 2012 Senate bid in Texas. Turns out, a Goldman Sachs loan did as well.
articles.abstract: As Mr. Cruz tells it, loyalty and sacrifice helped finance his 2012 Senate bid in Texas. Turns out, a Goldman Sachs loan did as well.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Ted Cruz tells it, the story of how he financed his upstart campaign for the United States Senate four years ago is an endearing example of loyalty and shared sacrifice between a married couple.

articles.headline: In Syrian Town Cut Off From the World, Glimpses of Deprivation
articles.snippet: Even now, after aid agencies negotiated to bring food and supplies to Madaya, there is little hope for change in a place trying to function while under siege.
articles.abstract: Even now, after aid agencies negotiated to bring food and supplies to Madaya, there is little hope for change in a place trying to function while under siege.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Nisrine kept teaching school for months as the siege tightened around the Syrian town of Madaya, but had to give up a few weeks ago when her students got too weak from starvation to walk to class. A local medic has been surviving on the rehydration salts he gives patients, while a business school graduate makes soup from grass for his 70-year-old father, consulting shepherds about which kinds their long-since-slaughtered flocks liked best.
articles.byline: By Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad
